conclusion: Analyze forces to find dynamic friction coefficient between ground and logs.
Logs form an isosceles triangle with top angle 120°, each log has mass m and radius R, logs are static.
Log A is supported by logs B and C, each contact point exerts a force F on A.
Forces F exerted by logs B and C on A are at 30° with horizontal, vertical components balance weight of log A, horizontal components are equal and opposite.
Vertical component of force by each log on A: F cos(30°) = F √3/2, 2F √3/2 = mg, F = mg/√3.
Horizontal component of force by each log on A: F sin(30°) = F 1/2, forces balance each other.
Friction force f on each log (B and C) is f = μ N, normal force N is 2mg, so f = μ (2mg).
Force exerted by log A on logs B and C: F = mg/√3, balanced by friction: μ (2mg) = mg/√3, μ = 1/2√3, μ = √3/6.
